storyTitle: As Employee, I want to filter my schedule by shift type to focus on relevant work periods

testCases.title: Validate filtering by single shift type
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has an active schedule with multiple shift types (Morning, Evening, Night)
Employee is on the schedule view page
Schedule contains at least one Morning shift and one non-Morning shift
Browser supports dynamic content updates

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule view page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view page loads successfully displaying all shifts for the employee

steps.action: Locate and click on the shift type filter dropdown/option
steps.expectedResult: Filter options panel opens showing available shift types (Morning, Evening, Night)

steps.action: Select 'Morning' shift type from the filter options
steps.expectedResult: Morning shift type is selected and highlighted in the filter interface

steps.action: Observe the schedule display update
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates dynamically without page reload to show only Morning shifts. All Evening and Night shifts are hidden. Filter response time is under 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify that only Morning shifts are displayed in the schedule
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts have shift type 'Morning'. No Evening or Night shifts are visible

steps.action: Click the 'Clear filter' button or option
steps.expectedResult: Clear filter action is triggered and filter selection is removed

steps.action: Observe the schedule display after clearing filter
steps.expectedResult: Full schedule is displayed showing all shift types (Morning, Evening, Night). Schedule returns to default view without page reload

postconditions: Schedule view displays all shifts without any filters applied
Filter interface is reset to default state
Employee remains logged in and on the schedule view page
No error messages are displayed

testCases.title: Validate filtering by multiple shift types
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has an active schedule with multiple shift types (Morning, Evening, Night)
Employee is on the schedule view page
Schedule contains at least one Morning shift, one Evening shift, and one Night shift
Multi-select filter functionality is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule view page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view page loads successfully displaying all shifts for the employee

steps.action: Locate and click on the shift type filter dropdown/option
steps.expectedResult: Filter options panel opens showing available shift types with multi-select capability

steps.action: Select 'Morning' shift type from the filter options
steps.expectedResult: Morning shift type is selected and highlighted. Filter remains open for additional selections

steps.action: Select 'Evening' shift type from the filter options while Morning is still selected
steps.expectedResult: Both Morning and Evening shift types are selected and highlighted in the filter interface

steps.action: Apply the filter or observe automatic update
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates dynamically without page reload to show shifts matching either Morning or Evening type

steps.action: Verify that only Morning and Evening shifts are displayed
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts have shift type 'Morning' or 'Evening'. Night shifts are hidden. Filter response time is under 2 seconds

steps.action: Count the total number of shifts displayed and verify against expected count
steps.expectedResult: Total number of displayed shifts equals the sum of Morning and Evening shifts in the employee's schedule

postconditions: Schedule view displays only Morning and Evening shifts
Filter interface shows both Morning and Evening as selected
Employee remains logged in and on the schedule view page
Night shifts remain in the database but are filtered from view

testCases.title: Test handling of invalid shift type filter
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has an active schedule with shifts
Employee has access to browser URL bar or developer tools
System has validation rules for shift type parameters
Valid shift types are: Morning, Evening, Night

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule view page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view page loads successfully displaying all shifts for the employee

steps.action: Note the current URL in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: URL is visible and follows the pattern /api/schedules?employeeId={id}

steps.action: Manually modify the URL to include an invalid shift type parameter (e.g., /api/schedules?employeeId={id}&shiftType=InvalidType)
steps.expectedResult: Modified URL is entered in the address bar

steps.action: Press Enter to navigate to the modified URL
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request with invalid shift type parameter

steps.action: Observe the system response and error handling
steps.expectedResult: System returns a validation error message indicating invalid shift type. Error message is clear and user-friendly (e.g., 'Invalid shift type. Please select from: Morning, Evening, Night')

steps.action: Verify the schedule display after validation error
steps.expectedResult: System defaults to full schedule view showing all shifts without any filter applied. No shifts are incorrectly filtered or hidden

steps.action: Verify that the filter interface is in default state
steps.expectedResult: No shift type filters are selected. Filter dropdown shows default/unselected state

postconditions: Schedule displays all shifts in default view
Validation error message is displayed to the user
No invalid data is processed or stored
Employee remains logged in and can continue using the system
System logs the validation error for security monitoring

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to search my schedule by date to quickly find shifts on specific days

testCases.title: Validate successful search by valid date
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has an active schedule with shifts on multiple dates
Employee is on the schedule page
At least one shift exists for the date to be searched
Date picker or search field is visible and functional
System accepts date format YYYY-MM-DD or MM/DD/YYYY

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully displaying the employee's full schedule

steps.action: Locate the date search field or date picker input
steps.expectedResult: Date search field is visible and enabled for input

steps.action: Click on the date search field to activate it
steps.expectedResult: Date search field is focused and ready for input. Date picker calendar may appear if applicable

steps.action: Enter a valid date that has scheduled shifts (e.g., 2024-03-15 or 03/15/2024)
steps.expectedResult: Date is entered successfully in the search field. Date format is accepted by the system

steps.action: Press Enter or click the Search button to execute the search
steps.expectedResult: Search request is submitted to the system

steps.action: Observe the schedule display update
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates dynamically without page reload to show only shifts for the searched date. Search response time is under 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify that only shifts for the searched date are displayed
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts have the date matching the searched date. Shifts from other dates are hidden. Shift details (time, type, location) are accurate

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Clear search' button or option
steps.expectedResult: Clear search action is triggered

steps.action: Observe the schedule display after clearing search
steps.expectedResult: Full schedule view is restored showing all shifts across all dates. Schedule updates dynamically without page reload. Date search field is cleared

postconditions: Schedule view displays all shifts without any search filters applied
Date search field is empty and ready for new input
Employee remains logged in and on the schedule page
No error messages are displayed
System state is reset to default schedule view

testCases.title: Validate rejection of invalid date input
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee is on the schedule page
Date search field is visible and functional
System has date format validation rules in place
Expected valid date formats are documented (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD, MM/DD/YYYY)

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully displaying the employee's full schedule

steps.action: Locate the date search field
steps.expectedResult: Date search field is visible and enabled for input

steps.action: Click on the date search field to activate it
steps.expectedResult: Date search field is focused and ready for input

steps.action: Enter an invalid date format (e.g., '32/13/2024', 'invalid-date', '2024-13-45', or 'abc123')
steps.expectedResult: Invalid date string is entered in the search field

steps.action: Press Enter or click the Search button to attempt the search
steps.expectedResult: System validates the date input

steps.action: Observe the system response to invalid date input
steps.expectedResult: System displays a clear error message indicating invalid date format (e.g., 'Invalid date format. Please use YYYY-MM-DD or MM/DD/YYYY'). Error message is displayed near the search field or in a notification area

steps.action: Verify that the search was not performed
steps.expectedResult: Schedule display remains unchanged showing the full schedule. No API call is made to search with invalid date. Search field retains the invalid input for user correction

steps.action: Verify that the schedule data is still accessible
steps.expectedResult: Full schedule remains visible and functional. No data loss or corruption occurred

postconditions: Error message is displayed to the user
Schedule displays full schedule without any search applied
Invalid date input remains in the search field for correction
Employee remains logged in and can continue using the system
No invalid search is logged or processed
System is ready to accept corrected date input

testCases.title: Test access control on search results
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has a known employee ID (e.g., employeeId=123)
Another employee exists in the system with a different ID (e.g., employeeId=456)
Employee is on the schedule page
Employee has access to browser URL bar or developer tools
System has authentication and authorization controls in place

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully displaying the logged-in employee's schedule

steps.action: Note the current URL in the browser address bar (e.g., /api/schedules?employeeId=123&date=2024-03-15)
steps.expectedResult: URL is visible and contains the logged-in employee's ID

steps.action: Manually modify the URL to change the employeeId parameter to another employee's ID (e.g., /api/schedules?employeeId=456&date=2024-03-15)
steps.expectedResult: Modified URL with different employee ID is entered in the address bar

steps.action: Press Enter to navigate to the modified URL
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request with unauthorized employee ID

steps.action: Observe the system response to unauthorized access attempt
steps.expectedResult: System detects authorization violation and denies access. Access denied error message is displayed (e.g., 'Access Denied: You are not authorized to view this employee's schedule' or HTTP 403 Forbidden)

steps.action: Verify that no schedule data for the other employee is displayed
steps.expectedResult: No shifts or schedule information for the unauthorized employee ID is shown. Other employee's data remains protected and inaccessible

steps.action: Verify redirection or error page display
steps.expectedResult: User is either redirected back to their own schedule page or shown an error page. Logged-in employee's own schedule may be displayed, or a blank schedule with error message

steps.action: Check that the session remains valid
steps.expectedResult: Employee remains logged in. Session is not terminated due to authorization failure

postconditions: Access denied error is displayed to the user
No unauthorized schedule data is exposed
Employee is redirected to their own schedule or error page
Employee remains logged in with valid session
Security event is logged for audit purposes
System maintains data privacy and access control integrity
